com.rbbn.cpaas.mobile.authentication.api

Interface Authentication


  • public interface Authentication
    This class handles connecting and disconnecting from CPaaS backend services.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String idToken,
             int lifetime,
             ConnectionCallback callback)
      throws MobileException
        Connect CPaaS with idToken and lifetime.

        Establishes a connection for the user with given idToken, which will last until the time given with lifetime is elapsed. Authentication needs access token in order to get and establish Websocket subscription. So before using this method, access token should be given to the Authentication with calling setToken(String) method. 

             
          cPaaS.getAuthentication().setToken("token");
          cpaas.getAuthentication().connect("user@domain.com", 3600, new ConnectionCallback() {
              public void onSuccess(String channelInfo) {

                  //   channelInfo should be persisted in the storage here in order to use it in the future
                  //  for connecting to same channel until channel lifetime expires

                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connected to websocket successfully");
              }

              public void onFail(MobileError error) {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connection to websocket failed");
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        idToken - idToken of the client
        lifetime - subscription lifetime in seconds
        callback - to get result of the operation asynchronously
        Throws:
        MobileException
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String idToken,
             java.lang.String accessToken,
             int lifetime,
             ConnectionCallback callback)
      throws MobileException
        Connect CPaaS with idToken and accessToken and lifetime.

        Establishes a connection for the user with given idToken, which will last until the time given with lifetime is elapsed, using given accessToken. accessToken will be set internally and then connection will be established just like the connect(String, int, ConnectionCallback) method. 

             
          cpaas.getAuthentication().connect("user@domain.com", "token" 3600, new ConnectionCallback() {
              public void onSuccess(String channelInfo) {

                  //   channelInfo should be persisted in the storage here in order to use it in the future
                  //  for connecting to same channel until channel lifetime expires

                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connected to websocket successfully");
              }

              public void onFail(MobileError error) {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connection to websocket failed");
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        idToken - idToken of the client
        accessToken - OAuth 2.0 access token gathered for the user after authorization to CPaaS
        lifetime - subscription lifetime in seconds
        callback - to get result of the operation asynchronously
        Throws:
        MobileException
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String idToken,
             int lifetime,
             java.lang.String channelInfo,
             ConnectionCallback callback)
      throws MobileException
        Connects CPaaS with idToken, lifetime and channel-info.

        Channel-info consists information about lifetime and channel URL of the Websocket channel. Instead of getting new channel URL, this method can be called if channel-info is known in order to connect specified channel URL. If lifetime information doesn't expired in the channel-info, Authentication uses lifetime and channel URL information in the channel-info in order to connect and returns new channel-info on the ConnectionCallback. If lifetime is expired, then a new connection is established. 

             
          cPaaS.getAuthentication().setToken("token");
          cpaas.getAuthentication().connect("user@domain.com", 3600, "channelInfo", new ConnectionCallback() {
              public void onSuccess(String channelInfo) {

                  //   channelInfo should be persisted in the storage here in order to use it in the future
                  //  for connecting to same channel until channel lifetime expires

                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connected to websocket successfully");
              }

              public void onFail(MobileError error) {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connection to websocket failed");
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        idToken - idToken of the client
        lifetime - subscription lifetime in seconds
        channelInfo - channel info string which can be used to connect an existing channel until the session ends
        callback - to get result of the operation asynchronously
        Throws:
        MobileException
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String idToken,
             java.lang.String accessToken,
             int lifetime,
             java.lang.String channelInfo,
             ConnectionCallback callback)
      throws MobileException
        Connects CPaaS with idToken, access token, lifetime and channel-info.

        Similar to the connect(String, int, String, ConnectionCallback) method, access token can be also given within the same method. Method will set the access token internally. 

             
          cpaas.getAuthentication().connect("user@domain.com", "token", 3600, "channelInfo", new ConnectionCallback() {
              public void onSuccess(String channelInfo) {

                  //   channelInfo should be persisted in the storage here in order to use it in the future
                  //  for connecting to same channel until channel lifetime expires

                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connected to websocket successfully");
              }

              public void onFail(MobileError error) {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Connection to websocket failed");
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        idToken - idToken of the client
        accessToken - OAuth 2.0 access token gathered for the user after authorization to CPaaS
        lifetime - subscription lifetime in seconds
        channelInfo - channel info string which can be used to connect an existing channel until the session ends
        callback - to get result of the operation asynchronously
        Throws:
        MobileException
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(DisconnectionCallback callback)
         throws MobileException
        Disconnect from CPaaS. This will close the webSocket and other services' connection. 

             
          cpaas.getAuthentication().disconnect(new DisconnectionCallback() {
              public void onSuccess() {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Disconnected from websocket successfully");
              }

              public void onFail(MobileError error) {
                  Log.i("CPaaS.Authentication", "Disconnection from websocket failed");
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        callback - to get result of the operation asynchronously
        Throws:
        MobileException
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setAuthenticationListener

        void setAuthenticationListener(AuthenticationListener listener)
        Listens the events and status changes. 

             
          cPaaS.getAuthentication().setAuthenticationListener(new AuthenticationListener() {
          // Implemented method AuthenticationListener
              public void connectionStatusChanged(ConnectionState state) {
                  Log.i("AuthenticationListener", "Connection Status is changed. New State: " + state);
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        listener - to notify for events
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setToken

        void setToken(java.lang.String accessToken)
        Sets access token to the authentication. 

             
          cPaaS.getAuthentication().setAuthenticationListener(new AuthenticationListener() {
          // Implemented method AuthenticationListener
              public void connectionStatusChanged(ConnectionState state) {
                  Log.i("AuthenticationListener", "Connection Status is changed. New State: " + state);
              }
          });
        Parameters:
        accessToken - OAuth 2.0 access token gathered for the user after authorization to CPaaS
        Since:
        1.0.0

        Returns the connection state of the Mobile SDK to CPaaS backend.
        Returns:
        connection state
